reg:regulation.reg:title: Nurses (Licensed Practical) Regulation
reg:regulation.reg:amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 20/2012, March 1, 2012]

bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Health Professions Act;
compound means to mix with one or more other ingredients,
dispense has the same meaning as in the Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: excluding a sale as defined in that Act, and

including receipt of payment on behalf of a registrant's employer for a drug dispensed or administered by the registrant, if the registrant's employer lawfully requires payment for that drug from a person in respect of the individual for or to whom it is dispensed or administered;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: nurse practitioner means a person who is authorized under the bylaws of the College of Registered Nurses of British Columbia to practise nursing as a nurse practitioner;
registered nurse means a person authorized under the Act to practise nursing.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The name "College of Licensed Practical Nurses of British Columbia" is the name of the college established under section 15 (1) of the Act for practical nursing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The title "licensed practical nurse" is reserved for exclusive use by registrants.
This section does not prevent a person from using the title "nurse" in a manner authorized by another regulation under section 12 of the Act.
A registrant may provide such nursing services related to the care of patients as are consistent with his or her training and ability.
A registrant in the course of providing nursing services may, in respect of a drug specified in Schedule II of the Drug Schedules Regulation, B.C. Reg. 9/98,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by intradermal, intramuscular or subcutaneous injection,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: for the purpose of preventing disease using immunoprophylactic agents.

Except in an emergency, or when providing nursing services in accordance with section 4 (2) and subsection (1.1) of this section, all nursing services provided by a registrant must be carried out under the direction of a medical practitioner or nurse practitioner who is attending the patient or under the supervision of a registered nurse who is providing services to the patient.

A registrant may perform an activity described in section 4 (2) without the direction of a medical practitioner or nurse practitioner or the supervision of a registered nurse only if standards, limits and conditions have been established, under section 19 (1) (k) or (1) of the Act, respecting the compounding, dispensing and administering of the drug by registrants without that direction or supervision.
Subject to section 4, a registrant may provide a nursing service for a patient in a private home provided that the attending medical practitioner or nurse practitioner gives directions.
A registrant may not provide nursing services to patients except in accordance with this section and section 4.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The college is designated for the purposes of section 16 (2) (f) of the Act.
